The following provides a compact listing about resources and material I found interesting, on both parenting and early childhood education. This includes books, blogs, and podcasts. The intent is to make use of those resources, plus notes collectedfrom our parenting coach, as a source of material for subsequent posts on the topic of parenting and early childhood education.


## Parenting

### Books

- The Whole-Brain Child: 12 Revolutionary Strategies to Nurture Your Child’s Developing Mind by Daniel J. Siegel and Tina Payne Bryson
- Brain Rules for Baby (Updated and Expanded): How to Raise a Smart and Happy Baby Child from Zero to Five by John Medina
- How Children Succeed: Grit, Curiosity, and the Hidden Power of Character by Paul Tough
- How to Talk So Kids Will Listen & Listen So Kids Will Talk by Adele Faber and Elaine Mazlish
- No-Drama Discipline. The Whole-Brain Way to Calm the Chaos and Nurture Your Child's Developing Mind by Daniel J. Siegel and Tina Payne Bryson
- Parenting from the Inside Out. How A Deeper Self-Understanding Can Help You Raise Children Who Thrive by Daniel J. Siegel and Mary Hartzell
- How To Get Kids To Say Yes!: Using the Secret Four Color Languages to Get Kids to Listen by

### Blogs and websites
- [50 OF THE BEST BOOKS FOR PARENTS](https://www.early-childhood-education-degrees.com/best-books-for-parents/)
- [Pathways](https://pathways.org/)
- [Resources from Erikson Institute](https://www.erikson.edu/services/center-children-families/)


## Early Childhood Education

### Books
- Tools of the Mind: The Vygotskian Approach to Early Childhood Education (2nd Edition) by elena Bodrova and Deorah J. Leong
- Who Am I in the Lives of Children? An Introduction to Early Childhood Education (10th Edition) by Stephanie Feeney and Eva Moravick
- Mind in the Making: The Seven Essential Life Skills Every Child Needs by Ellen Galinsky
- The Complete Resource Book for Preschoolers: Over 2000 Activities and Ideas (Complete Resource Series) by Pam Schiller and Kay Hastings
- Where’s the Math? Books, Games, and Routines to Spark Children’s Thinking

### Blogs and websites
- [Early Math Collaborative from Erikson Institute](https://earlymath.erikson.edu/)
- [THE 40 BEST BOOKS ON EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION](https://www.early-childhood-education-degrees.com/features/best-books-early-childhood-education/)
